Change S4 objects in diyar to data frames and vice versa

Source: R/to_s4.R
to_s4.Rd

Convert pid, epid, pane or number_line objects to a data.frame and vice versa.

to_df(s4, ...)

to_s4(df)

Arguments

s4

pid, epid, pane or number_line objects
...

Arguments passed to data.frame
df

data.frame

Value

to_df - data.frame object

to_s4 - pid, epid, pane or number_line objects

Examples

data(infections)
dates <- infections$date
output <- episodes(dates, case_length=30)
output
#>  [1] "E.1 (C)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.7 (C)"
#>  [8] "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)"

# Change a pid, epid, pane or number_line object to a data.frame
df_output <- to_df(output)
df_output
#>    epid sn wind_nm case_nm dist_wind_index dist_epid_index epid_total iteration
#> 1     1  1       0       0          0 days          0 days          6         1
#> 2     1  2       0       2          6 days          6 days          6         1
#> 3     1  3       0       2         12 days         12 days          6         1
#> 4     1  4       0       2         18 days         18 days          6         1
#> 5     1  5       0       2         24 days         24 days          6         1
#> 6     1  6       0       2         30 days         30 days          6         1
#> 7     7  7       0       0          0 days          0 days          5         2
#> 8     7  8       0       2          6 days          6 days          5         2
#> 9     7  9       0       2         12 days         12 days          5         2
#> 10    7 10       0       2         18 days         18 days          5         2
#> 11    7 11       0       2         24 days         24 days          5         2

# Change a data.frame to a pid, epid, pane or number_line object
s4_output <- to_s4(df_output)
s4_output
#>  [1] "E.1 (C)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.1 (D)" "E.7 (C)"
#>  [8] "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)" "E.7 (D)"
